column5: Next weeks weather in chapleau is going to be in the 70-80 degree range how do you guys think this is going to effect the fishing for me? Right now it's in the 50-60 range.
It's going to warm the shallows up and the walleye will be in the warm(er) water.
Everything will be in the warmer water, we may even get lucky and have the smallies in shallower. We're right by shallow bays with a river, great starting point.
I just hope it doesn't snow or get to 90 and sunny.
Well you won't need your long johns those days, we will be leaving the 28th and head up we'll cool it off for yea. Paul
I officially give up watching the weather for our trip! They change it drastically every day. I will just pack a little of everything and hope for the best.
